get.description: Retrieves a list of Subscriptions. This can be used to get a cross-account list of subscriptions, or for a given account using the “account” query parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned, between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Limit the subscription list to a specified account id or vid - if specified, all Subscriptions associated with that Account.

parameters.name: include_children
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not to return any existing child accounts’ subscriptions for a given returned Subscription/account combination.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Limit the Subscription list to those associated with a specific email.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: Limit the Subscription list to those that have a specified product id or vid as a SubscriptionItem.

total_count.description: Integer count of the number of items in the returned list.

url.description: The query string provided in the request

next.description: The route (partial URL) to the next Subscription object (string to select the “next”); included id should match that of the last object returned here

previous.description: The route (partial URL) to the previous Subscriptions object (string to select the “previous”); included id should match that of the first object returned here

post.description: Create Subscription

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Indicates whether to commit changes or return results without execution.

parameters.name: isMoved
parameters.description: Indicates if this is a billing subscription being converted to entitlement.

schema.description: The Error object contains information about the error. invalid-plm-product - The PLM product referenced by the product defined in the SLM cannot be found. invalid-partner-agreement - Unable to find agreement for the partner product referenced by the SLM product  in the create subscription operation. invalid-request - generic error code used for other validation errors.

get.description: Retrieves a specific Subscription.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to retrieve

post.description:
Update, amend, or modify a Subscription. See MarketONE Knowledgebase regarding various modify scenarios and additional approaches. 

Most common modifications are **Billing Plan Change**, **Add** or **Remove** a Subscription Item. 

**Replace an existing Subscription Item** with a new one. This request supports the same arguments as 'create’ (a full Subscription object) excepting the behavior of the ids; providing an id or vid in the URL indicates to MarketONE that this is an update, not a create – as such, id and vid cannot be updated. Certain changes will modify the subscribed service:

**Billing Plan Change**: Providing a new Billing Plan will change the billing plan/schedule for the subscription as of the effective_date. Replace an existing/active Item with a new Item: Include a new `SubscriptionItem` populating the “replaces” parameter with the id of the existing item being replaced. Add a new Item: Include a new `SubscriptionItem` (leaving undefined the “replaced_by” and “replaces” parameters). 

**Remove an existing Item**: Include a new but empty/undefined `SubscriptionItem` populating **ONLY** the “replaces” parameter with the id of the existing item being removed. All changes will take effect as of the effective_date provided; Proration calculations, when required, will use the period between the last scheduled billing and the effective_date (calculated to whole days).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to be updated.

parameters.name: bill_prorated_period
parameters.description: Indicates whether to prorate for unused service portions.

parameters.name: effective_date
parameters.description: Billing date at which changes take effect; today or next_billing

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Indicates whether to commit changes or return results without execution

post.description: Update a specific Subscription"s metadata. The whole metadata object is replaced with the content sent in the request body. This is not a a "delta" update, make sure to submit the complete metadata set.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to be updated.

post.description: Cancel a subscription, with options to select immediate disentitlement versus registering the cancel now to take affect at the end of the current period; to select whether any pre-paid services should get a prorated refund; and to select whether or not an existing minimum commitment should be honored. The reason for the cancellation can also be tracked using Cancel Reason codes (which can use pre-defined codes or codes you’ve designed yourself in advance).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to cancel

parameters.name: disentitle
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not to dis-entitle immediately or leave service in effect until the end of the current billing period.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Indicates whether to ignore unsatisfied minimum commitments

parameters.name: settle
parameters.description: Indicates whether to issue a prorated refund for any pre-paid unconsumed services and to rate unbilled usage.

parameters.name: send_cancellation_notice
parameters.description: Indicates whether to send a special cancellation notice to the customer

parameters.name: dryrun
parameters.description: Applicable only in case of immediate cancel (disentitle=true)

post.description: Reactivating a subscription makes a Subscription in Pending Cancel status Active again.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Subscription to reactivate

post.description: Pause a Subscription with immediate effect. If no other action is taken upon the Subscription, it will remain paused for 5 years and then cancel. Only Active/Good Standing Subscriptions can be paused. Paused Subscriptions can only be resumed or cancelled. Entitlements granted from any Product or the Billing Plan of the Subscription are stopped on the date of the pause request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to pause

parameters.name: effective_date
parameters.description: Billing date at which changes take effect; today, nextBill or next_billing

parameters.name: reason_code
parameters.description: The predefined reason code for pausing this subscription.

post.description: Resume a Subscription with immediate effect. If no other action is taken upon the Subscription, it will remain paused for 5 years and then cancel. Only Active/Good Standing Subscriptions can be paused. Paused Subscriptions can only be resumed or cancelled. Entitlements granted from any Product or the Billing Plan of the Subscription are stopped on the date of the pause request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription to pause

parameters.name: reset
parameters.description: Optional Boolean flag to reset the billing cycle to the current date of the resume operation.

get.description: MarketONE Partner aggregators can now leverage this API that retrieves an array of future transactions for a specified subscription. Aggregators can use that transaction information to provide context to their end customers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or the vid of the Subscription

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of future transactions to fetch. The amount to fetch must be between 1-5.

get.description: Retrieves all transactions. This API is only available to aggregators (for example CSPs).

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order the List of Transactions in either asc, ascending, or desc, descending order.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified account id or vid - if specified, all Transactions associated with that Account. Either Account or subscription required

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified subscription id or vid - if specified, all Transactions associated with that subscription.Either Account or subscription required

parameters.name: include_children
parameters.description: Indicates whether or not to return any existing child accounts’ transactions for a given returned Subscription/account combination.

parameters.name: campaign
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified campaign id or vid - if specified, all Transactions associated with that campaign.

parameters.name: coupon
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified campaign coupon - if specified, all Transactions associated with that campaign coupon.

parameters.name: starts
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified campaign start datetime

parameters.name: ends
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified campaign end datetime.

parameters.name: source_payment_method
parameters.description: Limit the transaction list to a specified PaymentMethod type.

get.description: Retrieves a specific campaign.

post.description: Update an existing Campaigns.

get.description: This method checks if a coupon or promotion can be used.

post.description: This method checks if a coupon or promotion can be used.
This method checks if a coupon or promotion can be used.
Cancels a specific Campaign.

Generates additional coupon codes, on demand. Available when the coupon campaign is already active.

* Incremental coupons are only available after the campaign's original coupons were fully generated and relevant for active coupon campaigns.
* In order to generate incremental coupon codes, on_demand_codes_allowed campaign attribute must be enabled (1) in the Campaign object.
* The response to the call provides a list of the coupon codes for use and redemption by the customers. Incremental codes are not generated in the Subscribe Portal. You may choose to add an additional security step that requires activation of the codes prior to redemption. See coupon_code_requires_activation in the Campaign object.
* The maximal number of codes per generation attempt is 100.

total_count.description: Integer count of the number of items in the returned list.

url.description: The query string provided in the request

next.description: The route (partial URL) to the next Transaction object (string to select the “next”); included id should match that of the last object returned here.

previous.description: The route (partial URL) to the previous Transaction object (string to select the “previous”); included id should match that of the first object returned here.
